3. Municipal Court

Municipal Court
===============

The Municipal Court of Falfurrias, Texas, is the local arm of the judicial system, where traffic laws, criminal laws, and municipal ordinances are enforced within the court's jurisdiction. The court's open hours are Monday through Friday, from 8 am to 5 pm. Furthermore, our court's staff works through lunch to ensure that residents are able to access services during lunch hours. Our court focuses on forms of complaints against juveniles and adults.

### Meet Your Municipal Court Administration:

1. ![Jessica Salinas](https://www.falfurrias.us/ImageRepository/Document?documentID=208 "Jessica Salinas")

   #### Jessica Salinas

   Court Clerk

1. ![Laura Salinas](https://www.falfurrias.us/ImageRepository/Document?documentID=207 "Laura Salinas")

   #### Laura Salinas

   Deputy Court Clerk

Traffic
-------

Traffic tickets issued by the Falfurrias Police Department and the Texas Department of Public Safety (DPS) are handled by the court. Inquiries on Driving Safety Courses can also be directed to the court.

Criminal
--------

Class C misdemeanors are handled by the court, including, but not limited to, assault, public intoxication, disorderly conduct, etc.

Municipal Ordinances
--------------------

Code enforcement violations and complaints filed by our code enforcement officers, including tall grass, junked vehicles, and pet violations, among others.

Jurisdiction
------------

The Falfurrias municipal judge is also the magistrate for defendants arrested in the City of Falfurrias and performs weddings. However, the municipal court does not handle civil lawsuits, landlord-tenant cases, or small claims.

Pay Tickets/Fines and Deferred Disposition
------------------------------------------

You can pay for any pending tickets at our office location, 215 E Allen Street, Falfurrias, TX. 78355, or by phone at 361-325-5039, during open hours. You may also contact our office for any inquiries on deferred dispositions.
